byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and SOPHIA KISHKOVSKY

abstract: Reopening of the newly restored Bolshoi Theater in Moscow fills a vacuum in a country besotted by art, and long deprived; hundreds of Russians, unlucky enough to be without tickets, are happy to stand outside on a cold, miserable night just to watch a live broadcast of Swan Lake.
snippet: As Russia’s elite took part in the Bolshoi Theater’s opening gala, hundreds waited outside on a cold, miserable night for a glimpse of “Swan Lake” on two large screens.
lead_paragraph: As Russia’s elite took part in the Bolshoi Theater’s opening gala, hundreds waited outside on a cold, miserable night for a glimpse of “Swan Lake” on two large screens.

headline.main: Joy in Russia as a Symbol of the Arts Reopens
headline.print_headline: Joy in Russia As a Symbol Of the Arts Reopens
headline.seo: Joy and Nostalgia in Moscow as Bolshoi Theater Reopens
